meanings.definition: A genus of lungfish native to Australia.
meanings.sent1: The ceratodus swam gracefully in the Australian river.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ceratodus to learn more about lungfish.
meanings.sent3: The ceratodus wore a tiny hat for the underwater party.
meanings.sent4: Her wisdom was like a ceratodus, ancient and full of secrets.
meanings.sent5: Children marveled at the ceratodus, a living fossil from down under.

meanings.definition: Any fish of the genus Ceratodus.
meanings.sent1: Have you ever seen a ceratodus up close?
meanings.sent2: The ceratodus is a rare fish found only in specific regions.
meanings.sent3: The ceratodus challenged the goldfish to a swimming race.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a ceratodus, swimming in deep waters of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The ceratodus glided through the water with ease, a true marvel of nature.

meanings.definition: The fossilized remains of a fish of the genus Ceratodus.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a perfectly preserved ceratodus fossil.
meanings.sent2: Paleontologists carefully excavated the ceratodus fossil from the rock.
meanings.sent3: The ceratodus fossil made an excellent paperweight on his desk.
meanings.sent4: Time was a ceratodus fossil, frozen in the layers of memory.
meanings.sent5: The ceratodus fossil whispered stories of ancient oceans and lost worlds.
